article.title: Configuration using command-line options
article.description: An overview of Sync Gateway's command-line options

introduction.paragraph: This article describes how to use command-line options to configure Sync Gateway. This is notthe recommended approach. Using a configuration file is the recommended approach. For information about using a configuration file, see Configuration properties

Configuration determines the runtime behavior of Sync Gateway, for example, its server configuration and the database or set of databases with which a Sync Gateway instance can interact. All configuration properties have default values.
introduction.note: You can only specify a small subset of configuration properties as command-line options. Two command-line options do not have corresponding configuration properties: -help and -verbose

body.paragraph: You specify command-line options on the command line when you start Sync Gateway. You can prefix command-line options with one hyphen (-) or with two hyphens (--). Some command-line options have no following argument, for example, -verbose. Other command-line options take an argument, which you specify after an equal sign (=), for example, -bucket=db. Command-line options are case-insensitive. Here we use lower camel case.
Following are command-line options that you can specify when starting Sync Gateway:
